To contribute your ideas to improve the guest experience and continually strive to improve the department.

Why Deliveroo?

Why Deliveroo? When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting great food to your house in less than half an hour. Awesome right? But behind the scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challenges and an enormous opportunity ahead of us.

We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We’re a technology driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world, so come and join us for the ride.

What the team does?

Our Account Management team owns and manages our restaurant relationships.  As Deliveroo continues to scale, we become a major revenue channel for restaurants - aside from providing best-in-class support, we are restaurant consultants that use data-driven insight and industry knowledge to help our partner restaurants’ grow.  Our account managers are a passionate, dynamic group of team players that work well together and cross functionally with other departments...and of course, they’re fun, personable, and great at building relationships!

What you'll be doing?

Drive sales performance - own your portfolio partner’s platform business growth through proactive reporting, analysis, improvement projects, and identifying growth opportunities. You will work with both internal and external stakeholders to drive change and devise solutions to ensure issues are addressed and the accounts continue to grow.
Marketing - manage marketing and promotions planning for our restaurant partners as they join and scale on the platform. Keep on top of timelines and collaborate cross-functionally with our AM and Core Marketing teams to hit targets as we scale.
Consumer value proposition - build the processes that allow our grocery partners to succeed on the platform by developing an attractive value proposition for customers, including selection, promotions, pricing and service levels.
Stakeholder management - manage a portfolio of Deliveroo's most strategically important restaurant partners, including high sales volume drivers and global brands, and ensure that our internal stakeholders are supporting where appropriate.

Requirements

Background: 5 years’ experience in an account management or commercial role.
Analytical - able to cut through the noise, get deep into data and understand the data points that drive performance improvements for our grocery partners.
Partner-Focused - be obsessed with our restaurant partners. Use quantitative and qualitative data to build a service that is best for our customers.
Entrepreneurial - have ideas and strategies to drive growth of our joint business with our partners, with a willingness to trial at pace.
Adaptable Fixer - enthusiastic, flexible and adaptable with the ability to remove barriers and bottlenecks via facilitation, creativity and resourcefulness.  Know when you have enough insight to make-a-call and apply the 80 / 20 rule.
Cross-Functional Team Player - a collaborative team player who is able to get the best out of the people around you. Able to work effectively at all levels of Deliveroo and deliver success with and through others.
Upbeat, Confident and High Energy - bring freshness, energy and passion into the team.  Help create a working environment that is unique, spawns new ideas and is enjoyable for the other people involve

Benefits:

Become one of the key employees of a fast-growing, exciting startup changing the food delivery landscape
Open, respectful and fun company culture
Snacks and drinks provided (although not unlimited, you will never go thirsty or hungry)
Work with people who LOVE what they do
Meal allowance if you are required to work late
Free Deliveroo Plus - Free delivery and access to special offers

Life at Deliveroo

We are a growing team, with very large impact, seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, we’re always looking for new ideas and we’re very transparent about the decisions we make and why we make them.

There are so many questions we need to answer and plenty more we haven’t even encountered. How do data and technology help restaurants to grow as consumer habits change? How can we predict what someone wants to order for dinner long before the idea has even crossed their mind? At Deliveroo these are just some of the tough problems we are solving - and there is no challenge that cannot be yours. No solution is owned by a particular team, which means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous.

Diversity and Inclusion

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth, time away and relocation.

In 2018 we announced our decision to give every employee equity in the company. We did this because we wanted all of our employees, regardless of location, level or role to be owners and because we believe that this is the right thing to do. We believe this helps build a culture where everyone is committed and able to share in the company’s success.

We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing start-up’s around.

Job Duties:

Responsible for food promotions and food program deployments to F&B outlets
Collect market intelligence in terms of food trend and product performance for strategic planning
Plan and lead promotions/ food programs to achieve business targets, and evaluate the effectiveness of the activities
Actively involved in coordination of the schedules, logistics and details with both internal and external parties to ensure smooth execution
Assist company projects as assigned, including deliverables, timeline, cost, prioritization on resources to drive operational efficiency

 Job Requirements: 

With degree / vocational higher diploma in marketing or related discipline
With minimum 1-2 years experience of Food and Beverage marketing in hotel or hospitality industries
Fluent in spoken English and Putonghua
Good computer knowledge in MS Word, Excel and Chinese Word Processing
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Well organized, detailed minded and willing to learn
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are essential

We offer competitive remuneration package to the right candidates. Please apply with detailed resume and salary expectations to the Human Resources Department, Sodexo (Hong Kong) Limited by e-mail to hr.hk@ sodexo.com.  Please quote PR number on all correspondence.

*Personal data collected is for recruitment purposes only.

Responsibilities:

Plan and execute both traditional and digital marketing campaigns. Ie. seasonal drinks and food items, new menu launch, merchandise products and activities to drive sales revenue, traffic and brand visibility. 
Working with the inhouse Graphic Designer on materials including but not limited to in-shop and external collateral, leaflets, posters and panels. From concept, content creation to layout, production to distribution. 
Drive and implement strategic PR campaigns for brand positioning and enhancing brand image and awareness.
Analyze customer insights, consumer trends, market analysis, and marketing best practices to build successful strategies.
Managing the brand’s website, social media and mobile app. Build enthusiasm and momentum for our marketing initiatives. 
Build and drive e-commerce sales. Working with the purchasing department in sourcing products and launching on various e-commerce platforms to achieve fruitful revenue results. 
Establish and develop strong partnerships with local and international industry partners. 
Drive the loyalty program to engage and reward our loyal customers. 
Managing a small team of marketing talents and graphic designers.
Be accountable for marketing KPIs. Develop, track and report on ROI of campaigns, programs and tactics. 

Requirements:

Degree Holder in Communications, Marketing and Journalism preferred.
At least 4 years' relevant experience in retail marketing.  
In-house experience in a food and beverage industry is preferred.
Good network with the media, press, food critics and KOL is preferred.
Able to work independently and lead the team.
Have a passion for being creative and innovative. Excited to think outside the box and experience new things. 
Sense of urgency and good project management skills. 
Excellent level of written and spoken English and Cantonese. 
Good interpersonal, presentation, and communication skills.

We offer an attractive remuneration package and comprehensive fringe benefits to the right candidate.
